result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

John Sacia for the State.  Defendant did not appear.  Defendant's atty Charles Betthauser appeared.  Set for PLEAS.  Bond cont.

John Sacia for the State; Def appeared in custody in person w/atty Charles Betthauser.  No agreement.  STC set.  Bond cont.

Attorney Betthauser requested the 12/8/15 hearing be rescheduled. ADA Sacia does not object. Court approved request.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-08-2015 01:30 pm
John Sacia for the State; Def did not appear.  Def's atty, Charles Betthauser appeared in person.  PLEAS set.  Bond cont.
Status Conference at 11-19-2015 01:30 pm

John Sacia for the State; Def did not appear.  Def's atty, Charles Betthauser appeared in person.  STC set.  Atty Betthauser moves to modify cash bond.  State objects.  Court denies motion.  Bond cont. as is.

John Sacia for the State, def in custody and appeared in person with his attorney, Charles Betthauser.  Def withdrew NG plea by reason of mental illness disease or defect, matter set for STC.  Cash bond modified.

Defendant may be released to Scarseth House for purposes of inpatient treatment only.  Defendant not to consume or possess alcohol and not to enter bars or taverns.  Defendant not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Do not enter any place where alcohol is sold for consumption on premises.

Taavi McMahon for the State, def did not appear, def's attorney, Charles Betthauser, appeared in person.  Will change plea to NG by reason of mental illness or defect. Court orders assessment/report to be completed by 10/16/15.  RH set for 10/27/15.
Request from Def dated 9/8/15 to have Atty Betthauser appointed on this case as well.  Court approves request.
Status Conference at 09-10-2015 09:00 am
INIT - Tremp. Co. Jail

Defendant, Kurtis Benson Trocinski, appeared by video from Tremp. Co. Jail.  Taavi Mc Mahon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def did not receive copy of complaint.  Court reads complaint aloud to Def.  Court advised defendant of  rights.  Defendant KVI waives rights and Court enters plea of not guilty on Def's behalf.  Matter to be set for STC.  Def requests signature bond.  State objects.  Bond cont as is.  Status Conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Initial Appearance scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant may be released to Scarseth House for purposes of inpatient treatment only.  Defendant not to consume or possess alcohol and not to enter bars or taverns.  Defendant not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Do not enter any place where alcohol is sold for consumption on premises.
